title: FAKE ALERT: Doctored image of CM Yogi with a plate of meat goes viral - Times of India
subtitle: News News: Photo of Uttar Pradesh (UP) CM Yogi Adityanath sitting with a plate full of meat on his side is being circulated on social media platform Facebook. Th
author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim: Photo of Uttar Pradesh (UP) CM Yogi Adityanath sitting with a plate full of meat on his side is being circulated on social media platform Facebook. The photo is being used to insinuate that Yogi consumes meat.A Facebook user by the name of ‘JamiaFatema RlilBanat’ posted the image to take a dig at Yogi. The photo-post has received over 2500 shares so far.The photo is digitally-altered version of the original photo where the plate beside Yogi has Hindu puja items instead of meat.Using reverse-image search, we found the original photo.Journalist Vijaita Singh tweeted the original photo on July 27, 2018.The photo was taken in 2018 when photographs of a police officer in uniform kneeling down at the feet of Yogi, on the occasion of Guru Purnima at the Gorakhnath temple, went viral on social media.Outlook India carried the cropped version of the same image in a report dated July 28, 2018.Titled ‘It Was My Devotion To Mahant Yogi Adityanath, Says Cop Who Knelt Down Before UP CM’, the cop said he did so to take the blessings of Peethadishwar Mahant Yogi Adityanath.Moreover, Yogi in 2017, had claimed that he is a pure vegetarian.Times Fact Check has found that a digitally-manipulated photo of CM Yogi with a plate full of meat on his side is being circulated on social media.
